title: Asthma
description:
1. Sit the person upright and stay calm.
2. Give 4 puffs of a reliever inhaler (1 puff every 30-60 seconds).
3. Wait 4 minutes. If there is no improvement, give 4 more puffs.
4. If still no improvement, call emergency services.
5. Continue giving 4 puffs every 4 minutes until help arrives.

title: Burns
description:
1. Cool the burn under cool running water for at least 20 minutes.
2. Remove any tight clothing or jewelry near the burn site.
3. Cover it with a sterile, non-stick dressing or cloth.
4. Do not apply ice, creams, or greasy substances.
5. Seek medical help if the burn is severe or covers a large area.

title: Cardiac Arrest
description:
1. Check for responsiveness and normal breathing.
2. Call emergency services immediately.
3. Begin CPR if unresponsive and not breathing normally.
4. Use an AED if available and follow voice prompts.
5. Continue CPR until professional help arrives or signs of life appear.

title: CPR
description:
1. Place the heel of one hand in the center of the chest.
2. Place your other hand on top and interlock fingers.
3. Keep your arms straight and press down hard and fast — 100 to 120 compressions per minute.
4. Give 30 compressions followed by 2 rescue breaths (if trained).
5. Continue until help arrives or the person starts to breathe.

title: Fracture
description:
1. Keep the injured area still and supported.
2. Do not try to straighten the limb.
3. Apply a splint if trained and needed to immobilize.
4. Apply a cold pack wrapped in cloth to reduce swelling.
5. Seek immediate medical attention.

title: Sprain
description:
1. Follow the R.I.C.E method: Rest, Ice, Compression, Elevation.
2. Rest the injured limb and avoid movement.
3. Apply ice wrapped in a cloth for 15-20 minutes every 2-3 hours.
4. Compress with an elastic bandage to reduce swelling.
5. Elevate the limb above heart level.
6. Consult a doctor if severe pain or swelling persists.

title: Snake Bite
description:
1. Keep the person calm and still to slow venom spread.
2. Immobilize the bitten limb and keep it below heart level.
3. Do not suck or cut the bite area.
4. Do not apply a tourniquet or ice.
5. Call emergency services immediately and monitor vital signs.

title: Choking
description:
1. Ask the person if they are choking.
2. If they cannot speak, give 5 back blows between the shoulder blades.
3. Follow with 5 abdominal thrusts (Heimlich maneuver).
4. Alternate between 5 back blows and 5 thrusts until the object is expelled or the person becomes unresponsive.
5. If unresponsive, begin CPR and call emergency services.

title: Nosebleed
description:
1. Sit the person down and lean them forward slightly.
2. Pinch the soft part of the nose for 10-15 minutes.
3. Encourage them to breathe through their mouth.
4. Do not let them lie down or tilt their head back.
5. Seek medical help if bleeding continues beyond 20 minutes or is very heavy.

title: Seizure
description:
1. Stay calm and protect the person from injury.
2. Do not restrain or put anything in their mouth.
3. Cushion their head and loosen tight clothing.
4. Turn them onto their side after the seizure ends.
5. Call emergency services if the seizure lasts more than 5 minutes or if another begins immediately.

title: Heatstroke
description:
1. Move the person to a cool, shaded area.
2. Remove excess clothing.
3. Cool with water, fans, or wet cloths.
4. Give small sips of cool water if conscious.
5. Call emergency services immediately.

title: Eye Injuries
description:
1. Do not rub or apply pressure to the eye.
2. Flush with clean water if there’s a chemical exposure.
3. Cover with a sterile dressing or eye shield.
4. Do not attempt to remove embedded objects.
5. Seek immediate medical attention.

title: Head Injuries
description:
1. Keep the person still and calm.
2. Apply a cold pack to reduce swelling.
3. Monitor for signs of concussion (confusion, vomiting, drowsiness).
4. Do not let the person sleep if unconscious or confused.
5. Call emergency services if symptoms worsen.

title: Spinal Injuries
description:
1. Do not move the person unless in immediate danger.
2. Support the head and neck to prevent movement.
3. Call emergency services immediately.
4. Keep the person still and calm.
5. Monitor breathing and be prepared to provide CPR.

title: Electric Shock
description:
1. Do not touch the person until the power source is turned off.
2. Call emergency services immediately.
3. Check for responsiveness and breathing.
4. Begin CPR if necessary.
5. Treat any burns with cool water and cover with a clean cloth.

title: Hypothermia
description:
1. Move the person to a warm, sheltered area.
2. Remove wet clothing and wrap in warm blankets.
3. Warm the center of the body first (chest, neck, head).
4. Give warm drinks if conscious.
5. Seek immediate medical help.

title: Poisoning
description:
1. Identify the poison if possible.
2. Do not induce vomiting unless instructed.
3. Call emergency services or poison control.
4. If unconscious, place in recovery position.
5. Monitor breathing and be ready to perform CPR.

title: Bites and Stings
description:
1. Wash the area with soap and water.
2. Apply a cold pack to reduce swelling and pain.
3. Remove stinger if visible (scrape, don’t squeeze).
4. Monitor for allergic reactions.
5. Seek medical help if swelling spreads or severe symptoms occur.

title: Unconsciousness and Recovery Position
description:
1. Check for responsiveness and breathing.
2. Call emergency services.
3. If breathing and no spinal injury suspected, place in recovery position.
4. Tilt head back to keep airway open.
5. Monitor until help arrives.

title: First Aid Kit Usage
description:
1. Use gloves to protect yourself and the patient.
2. Clean wounds with antiseptic wipes.
3. Use bandages, gauze, and dressings to cover wounds.
4. Use cold packs for swelling.
5. Replenish used items promptly and store the kit in an accessible location.
